mechanics.condition: Target is a creature visible within range AND (Target is willing OR Target fails Wisdom Saving Throw)
mechanics.outcome: Target is transformed into a new form

mechanics.condition: Target is unwilling AND Target is not a shapechanger
mechanics.outcome: Target makes a Wisdom Saving Throw to avoid the effect
Target automatically succeeds on the Wisdom Saving Throw (cannot be transformed)
New form must be a Beast creature type
New form's Challenge Rating must be less than or equal to target's Challenge Rating (or target's level if it has no CR)
Target's game statistics (including mental ability scores) are replaced by the chosen beast's statistics
Target retains its alignment and personality
Target assumes the hit points of its new form (current and maximum)
Target returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed

mechanics.condition: Reversion occurs because transformed form dropped to 0 hit points
mechanics.outcome: Any excess damage carries over to target's normal form's hit points

mechanics.trigger: Target takes excess damage that carries over
mechanics.condition: Excess damage does NOT reduce target's normal form to 0 hit points

mechanics.outcome: Target's available actions are limited by the nature of its new form

mechanics.condition: Action requires hands OR Action requires speech
mechanics.outcome: Target cannot perform the action (e.g., cannot speak, cannot cast spells)
Target's gear melds into the new form
Target cannot activate, use, wield, or benefit from any of its equipment

mechanics.condition: Spell duration ends OR Target drops to 0 Hit Points OR Target dies
mechanics.outcome: Target reverts to its normal form

description_text: This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a wisdom saving throw to avoid the effect. A shapechanger automatically succeeds on this saving throw. The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 hit points or dies. The new form can be any beast whose challenge rating is equal to or less than the target's (or the target's level, if it doesn't have a challenge rating). The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its alignment and personality. The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 hit points, any excess damage carries over to its normal form. As long as the excess damage doesn't reduce the creature's normal form to 0 hit points, it isn't knocked unconscious. The creature is limited in the actions it can perform by the nature of its new form, and it can't speak, cast spells, or take any other action that requires hands or speech. The target's gear melds into the new form. The creature can't activate, use, wield, or otherwise benefit from any of its equipment.
